etymology.description: 又 'hand' + 火 'fire' - fire that can be touched with the hand (ash); 又 modified to 𠂇.
etymology.interpretation: Combines a hand with fire to evoke embers cool enough to be handled, i.e., ash. The upper strokes reflect a variant of 又, as also seen in 友 and 右.

examples.chinese: 火烧过后只剩下灰。(火燒過後只剩下灰。)
examples.pinyin: Huǒ shāo guò hòu zhǐ shèng xià huī.
examples.english: After the fire, only ash is left.

examples.chinese: 他一次失败就灰心了。(他一次失敗就灰心了。)
examples.pinyin: Tā yī cì shībài jiù huīxīn le.
examples.english: He became discouraged after a single failure.

examples.chinese: 请把炉子的灰倒掉，然后清理周围。(請把爐子的灰倒掉，然後清理周圍。)
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ lúzi de huī dào diào, ránhòu qīnglǐ zhōuwéi.
examples.english: Please dump the stove’s ash and then clean around it.
